* fix codecheck

content.raw: it could be a failing test in a different branch, or a test with expectations that match the current but not desired behavior
content.html: it could be a failing test in a different branch, or a test with expectations that match the current but not desired behavior

content.raw: You mean a failing test? I can add that to a different branch.
content.html: You mean a failing test? I can add that to a different branch.

content.raw: I guess we first need to add a test for the Attach*Joint functions
content.html: I guess we first need to add a test for the Attach*Joint functions

content.raw: are there some test expectations we could add to the Detach test that show its current limitations?
content.html: are there some test expectations we could add to the Detach test that show its current limitations?

content.raw: Creating a joint between two BodyNodes that belong to two different skeletons causes one of the BodyNodes to be moved to the skeleton of the other such that the two BodyNodes are now in the same skeleton. However, detaching the two BodyNodes using `DetachJoint` does not return the BodyNodes back to their original skeletons. This means that removing a detached model in ign-gazebo would not function properly because it would either not remove all the links in the model or end up removing links that are not in the model. This is not an immediate need right now, but a potential source of unexpected behavior. I'm okay with approving this PR and putting a warning in the ign-gazebo plugin that implements attaching/detaching models.
content.html: Creating a joint between two BodyNodes that belong to two different skeletons causes one of the BodyNodes to be moved to the skeleton of the other such that the two BodyNodes are now in the same skeleton. However, detaching the two BodyNodes using DetachJoint does not return the BodyNodes back to their original skeletons. This means that removing a detached model in ign-gazebo would not function properly because it would either not remove all the links in the model or end up removing links that are not in the model. This is not an immediate need right now, but a potential source of unexpected behavior. I'm okay with approving this PR and putting a warning in the ign-gazebo plugin that implements attaching/detaching models.

content.raw:
This looks good for a first pass at the feature.

The implementation will get significantly more complicated when we want to support closed kinematic chains, but if that’s not needed right now, then I see nothing wrong with this as it is.
content.html:
This looks good for a first pass at the feature.

The implementation will get significantly more complicated when we want to support closed kinematic chains, but if that’s not needed right now, then I see nothing wrong with this as it is.

content.raw:
Just a minor note: dartsim should guarantee that every valid BodyNode should have a valid parent joint, so we shouldn’t need to test that here.

If we want to audit the assumption that every BodyNode has a valid parent joint, I would recommend putting `assert(childsParentJoint);` before these if-statements instead. If that test ever fails, then there’s a serious bug in dartsim or in our use of dartsim.

‌
content.html:
Just a minor note: dartsim should guarantee that every valid BodyNode should have a valid parent joint, so we shouldn’t need to test that here.

If we want to audit the assumption that every BodyNode has a valid parent joint, I would recommend putting assert(childsParentJoint); before these if-statements instead. If that test ever fails, then there’s a serious bug in dartsim or in our use of dartsim.

‌
